title: K-ration
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/K-ration/zh-CN "K-ration/zh-CN")

| % [![K-ration.png](/images/4/42/K-ration.png)](/wiki/File:K-ration.png) |                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                    | K-ration                               |
| Base price                                                              | 25 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")       |
| Nutrition                                                               | [400](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")     |
| Turns to eat                                                            | 1                                      |
| Weight                                                                  | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")            |
| Conduct                                                                 | [vegan](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

The **K-ration** is a type of [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[Nethack](/wiki/Nethack "Nethack")*. It is [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy") and considered [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Origin](#Origin)

- [6 Messages](#Messages)

- [7 Variants](#Variants)

  - [7.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [7.2 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

- [8 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [9 References](#References)

## Generation

K-rations are not randomly generated.

[Mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenaries "Mercenaries") that are part of the [Yendorian Army](/wiki/Yendorian_Army "Yendorian Army") have a 1⁄3 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a K-ration.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

When [eaten](/wiki/Eaten "Eaten"), K-rations grant 400 [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), and usually take one move to consume similar to [C-rations](/wiki/C-ration "C-ration"). K-rations can [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [canines](/wiki/Canine "Canine") and [felines](/wiki/Feline "Feline") and pacify domestic [equines](/wiki/Equine "Equine").

## Strategy

K-rations are a valuable source of quick nutrition in desperate situations, and are plentiful for characters that can clear out [barracks](/wiki/Barracks "Barracks") like those found in [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") and the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). Though K-rations and C-rations are similar in function, K-rations have a higher nutrition value, and for non-[elven](/wiki/Elven_\(starting_race\) "Elven (starting race)") characters they are tied with the [lembas wafer](/wiki/Lembas_wafer "Lembas wafer") for the highest amount of nutrition per turn - this makes them a viable food type to carry in [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit"), especially when dealing with the risk of meeting [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine") on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane").

K-rations are prized by [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") [spellcasters](/wiki/Spellcaster "Spellcaster") who are not eligible for [hungerless casting](/wiki/Hungerless_casting "Hungerless casting").

## History

The K-ration first appears in [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[K-ration](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/K-ration "wikipedia:Special:Search/K-ration")***

K-rations are an old form of daily combat ration used by the US Army in World War II - the letter *K* has no particular significance, and was chosen simply because it was phonetically distinct from the other ration types (A, B, C, and D) in use at the time. Packed in three wax-paper boxes (one for each meal), they largely consisted of canned entrees and biscuits. The entrees were usually meat-based, and even the biscuits were not vegan, containing animal byproducts such as eggs and milk.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Intended as an emergency ration for short-term use, K-rations were lighter and more compact than C-rations, and also provided significantly fewer calories, in contrast to their superior nutritional value in *Nethack* (400 vs. 300). Despite K-rations' intended use as a short-term stopgap, in many cases they were given to soldiers for weeks or even months at a time. Their low caloric content often led to malnutrition, a situation made worse by their monotonous menus which frequently caused men to not eat the entire ration; due to this thorough unpopularity, the K-ration was discontinued shortly after World War II.

## Messages

- This K-ration is bland.

  You ate a non-cursed K-ration.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), K-rations can be [upgraded](/wiki/Upgraded "Upgraded") into [cram rations](/wiki/Cram_ration "Cram ration") or [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration"). This also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a K-ration can be created at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining a C-ration and a food ration.

## Encyclopedia entry

The K ration was the \[ Quartermaster Subsistence Research and Development Laboratory's ] answer to the demand for an individual, easy-to-carry ration that could be used in assault and combat operations. It was noted for compactness and superior packaging and was acknowledged as the ration that provided the greatest variety of nutritionally balanced components within the smallest space.

\[ Special Rations for the Armed Forces, 1946-53, by Franz A. Koehler ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 666](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L666)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [kration.info](http://www.kration.info/biscuits-2.html)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
K-ration

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name K-ration
Base price 25 zm
Nutrition 400
Turns to eat 1
Weight 10
Conduct vegan

The K-ration is a type of comestible that appears in Nethack. It is veggy and considered vegan.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Origin
  • 6 Messages
  • 7 Variants
    • 7.1 SLASH'EM
    • 7.2 SpliceHack
  • 8 Encyclopedia entry
  • 9 References

Generation

K-rations are not randomly generated.

Mercenaries that are part of the Yendorian Army have a 1⁄3 chance of being generated with a K-ration.[1]

Description

When eaten, K-rations grant 400 nutrition, and usually take one move to consume similar to C-rations. K-rations can tame domestic canines and felines and pacify domestic equines.

Strategy

K-rations are a valuable source of quick nutrition in desperate situations, and are plentiful for characters that can clear out barracks like those found in Fort Ludios and the Castle. Though K-rations and C-rations are similar in function, K-rations have a higher nutrition value, and for non-elven characters they are tied with the lembas wafer for the highest amount of nutrition per turn - this makes them a viable food type to carry in ascension kits, especially when dealing with the risk of meeting Famine on the Astral Plane.

K-rations are prized by vegan spellcasters who are not eligible for hungerless casting.

History

The K-ration first appears in NetHack 2.3e.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
K-ration

K-rations are an old form of daily combat ration used by the US Army in World War II - the letter K has no particular significance, and was chosen simply because it was phonetically distinct from the other ration types (A, B, C, and D) in use at the time. Packed in three wax-paper boxes (one for each meal), they largely consisted of canned entrees and biscuits. The entrees were usually meat-based, and even the biscuits were not vegan, containing animal byproducts such as eggs and milk.[2]

Intended as an emergency ration for short-term use, K-rations were lighter and more compact than C-rations, and also provided significantly fewer calories, in contrast to their superior nutritional value in Nethack (400 vs. 300). Despite K-rations' intended use as a short-term stopgap, in many cases they were given to soldiers for weeks or even months at a time. Their low caloric content often led to malnutrition, a situation made worse by their monotonous menus which frequently caused men to not eat the entire ration; due to this thorough unpopularity, the K-ration was discontinued shortly after World War II.

Messages

This K-ration is bland.
You ate a non-cursed K-ration.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, K-rations can be upgraded into cram rations or food rations. This also applies to SlashTHEM.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, a K-ration can be created at a furnace by combining a C-ration and a food ration.

Encyclopedia entry

The K ration was the [ Quartermaster Subsistence Research and Development Laboratory's ] answer to the demand for an individual, easy-to-carry ration that could be used in assault and combat operations. It was noted for compactness and superior packaging and was acknowledged as the ration that provided the greatest variety of nutritionally balanced components within the smallest space.

[ Special Rations for the Armed Forces, 1946-53, by Franz A. Koehler ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 666
  2. ↑ kration.info

The '''K-ration''' is a type of [[comestible]] that appears in ''[[Nethack]]''. It is [[veggy]] and considered [[vegan]].

==Generation==
K-rations are not randomly generated.

[[Mercenaries]] that are part of the [[Yendorian Army]] have a {{frac|3}} chance of [[monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a K-ration.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|666|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
When [[eaten]], K-rations grant 400 [[nutrition]], and usually take one move to consume similar to [[C-ration]]s. K-rations can [[tame]] [[domestic]] [[canine]]s and [[feline]]s and pacify domestic [[equine]]s.

==Strategy==
K-rations are a valuable source of quick nutrition in desperate situations, and are plentiful for characters that can clear out [[barracks]] like those found in [[Fort Ludios]] and the [[Castle]]. Though K-rations and C-rations are similar in function, K-rations have a higher nutrition value, and for non-[[Elven (starting race)|elven]] characters they are tied with the [[lembas wafer]] for the highest amount of nutrition per turn - this makes them a viable food type to carry in [[ascension kit]]s, especially when dealing with the risk of meeting [[Famine]] on the [[Astral Plane]].

K-rations are prized by [[vegan]] [[spellcaster]]s who are not eligible for [[hungerless casting]].

==History==
The K-ration first appears in [[NetHack 2.3e]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia}}
K-rations are an old form of daily combat ration used by the US Army in World War II - the letter ''K'' has no particular significance, and was chosen simply because it was phonetically distinct from the other ration types (A, B, C, and D) in use at the time. Packed in three wax-paper boxes (one for each meal), they largely consisted of canned entrees and biscuits. The entrees were usually meat-based, and even the biscuits were not vegan, containing animal byproducts such as eggs and milk.<ref>[http://www.kration.info/biscuits-2.html kration.info]</ref>

Intended as an emergency ration for short-term use, K-rations were lighter and more compact than C-rations, and also provided significantly fewer calories, in contrast to their superior nutritional value in ''Nethack'' (400 vs. 300). Despite K-rations' intended use as a short-term stopgap, in many cases they were given to soldiers for weeks or even months at a time. Their low caloric content often led to malnutrition, a situation made worse by their monotonous menus which frequently caused men to not eat the entire ration; due to this thorough unpopularity, the K-ration was discontinued shortly after World War II.

{{message|This K-ration is bland.|You ate a non-cursed K-ration.}}

==Variants==

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], a K-ration can be created at a [[furnace]] by combining a C-ration and a food ration.

==Encyclopedia entry==

The K ration was the [ Quartermaster Subsistence Research and Development Laboratory's ] answer to the demand for an individual, easy-to-carry ration that could be used in  assault and combat operations.  It was noted for compactness and superior packaging and was acknowledged as the ration that provided the greatest variety of nutritionally balanced components within the smallest space.
